8.m: John answered them all, saying, 'I baptize you with water, but he who is mightier than I is coming, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.' - Luke 3:16 (ESV)

l.q: What was John the Baptist tasked by God to do?
l.a: John the Baptist was told by God to prepare the way for the coming of the Savior by proclaiming baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

l.q: What is proof that a person has repented of his sins?
l.a: A person who repents turns away from his sins and bear good fruits in line with God's commands.

l.q: What is the difference between John's baptism and the Jesus Christ's?
l.a: John baptized people with water, but Christ will baptize people with the Holy Spirit and fire.

8.p: God, before I even participate in the joyous celebration of Christmas traditions with family and friends, help me to prepare my heart for Christ. May you deal with my pride and make me humble to admit my sins before you. Cleanse my heart and give me the right motives, that the good works that I do to others be pleasing in your sight. May you enable me to do things for your glory and not mine.
